description: Query scans entire table instead of using index, causing linear performance degradation as table grows.
commonCauses: No WHERE clause on large table
WHERE clause doesn't match any index
Implicit type conversion preventing index use
solutions: Add appropriate index for query pattern
Rewrite query to leverage existing indexes
Use LIMIT to reduce result set size
Split query into indexed parts with UNION
Avoid leading wildcards in LIKE queries
Use proper data types to avoid conversions
Consider full-text search for text queries
prevention: Always use WHERE clause with indexed column
Create indexes for all frequently queried columns
Use EXPLAIN QUERY PLAN to verify index usage
Avoid complex expressions in WHERE clause
Paginate large result sets with LIMIT/OFFSET
Monitor query execution time in production
examples: SELECT * FROM scans WHERE userId = ? LIMIT 100 -- Uses index
-- Avoid: SELECT * FROM scans WHERE CAST(timestamp AS TEXT) LIKE '%'
